alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 10:01PM CDT until May 24 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DEAF SMITH COUNTY... At 1001 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Hereford to 3 miles north of Summerfield to 3 miles north of Black to 6 miles north of Friona, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Locations impacted include... Hereford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
